FuncDef: The display nat memory-usage command displays memory usage of each type of entry on a specified service board.
CLIs: display nat memory-usage { fragment | servermap | session | user-information } [ slot <slot-id> { engine <cpu-id> | card <card-id> } ]
display nat memory-usage { fragment | servermap | session | user-information } [ slot <slot-id> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays memory usage of fragment entries on a specific service board.
-

Displays memory usage of server-map entries created in symmetric mode on a specific service board.
-

Displays memory usage of IPv4 session entries on a specific service board.
-

Displays memory usage of user entries on a service board.
-

Specifies the slot ID of a service board.
The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the base-board CPU ID of a service board. This parameter takes effect only on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
The value can be 0 to 3.

Specifies the CPU ID of a subcard on a service board.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 1.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display nat memory-usage fragment slot 1 engine 0
This operation will take a few minutes. Press 'Ctrl+C' to break ...
<HUAWEI> display nat memory-usage servermap slot 1 engine 0
This operation will take a few minutes. Press 'Ctrl+C' to break ...
<HUAWEI> display nat memory-usage session slot 1 engine 0
This operation will take a few minutes. Press 'Ctrl+C' to break ...
<HUAWEI> display nat memory-usage user-information slot 1 engine 0
This operation will take a few minutes. Press 'Ctrl+C' to break ...
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view memory usage of each type of entry on a specific service board, run the display nat memory-usage command. The command output helps determine whether one or more service boards need to be added.
